personal_data.description: Identifies a field that contains personal data, as defined by GDPR.

description: Host API documentation for applications providing REST APIs, facilitating the design of good resource first APIs.

values.description: The original is in the api.json format
values.name: api_json

values.description: The original is in Avro Idl format
values.name: avro_idl

values.description: This is the canonical service spec for apibuilder itself. See https://www.apibuilder.io/apicollective/apibuilder-spec/latest#model-service
values.name: service_json

values.description: The original in the Swagger JSON or YAML format
values.name: swagger

publication.description: A publication represents something that a user can subscribe to. An example would be subscribing to an email alert whenever a new version of an application is created.

values.description: For organizations for which I am an administrator, email me whenever a user applies to join the org.
values.name: membership_requests.create

values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever a user joins the org.
values.name: memberships.create

values.description: For organizations for which I am a member, email me whenever an application is created.
values.name: applications.create

values.description: For applications that I watch, email me whenever a version is created.
values.name: versions.create

visibility.description: Controls who is able to view this version

values.description: Only the creator can view this application
values.name: user

values.description: Any member of the organization can view this application
values.name: organization

values.description: Anybody, including non logged in users, can view this application
values.name: public

application.description: An application has a name and multiple versions of its API.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this application.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The unique name for this application.
fields.name: name

fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the application name.
fields.name: key

fields.description: Controls who is able to view this application
fields.name: visibility

fields.description: The updated_at of this application or created_at of it's latest version
fields.name: last_updated_at

fields.description: Defaults to a key generated from the application name
fields.name: key

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this application.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the application name.
fields.name: key

application_metadata_version.description: Describes the versions associated with a given application

application_summary.description: Summary of an application sufficient for display and links

attribute.description: Attributes are globally unique key which allow users to specify additional content to pass in to the code generators.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The name of the attribute. Globally unique and an 'identifier' (lower case, url safe, etc.)
fields.name: name

fields.description: Optional description - a good description here will indicate which code generators it applies to and what effect it will have on those code generators.
fields.name: description

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The name of the attribute. Globally unique and an 'identifier' (lower case, url safe, etc.)
fields.name: name

attribute_value.description: Attribute values can be set at different levels. Initially we support setting organization wide attributes, but in the future plan to support setting attribute values with each version of the application.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this attribute value.
fields.name: guid

authentication.description: Represents the result of a successful authorization

change.description: Represents a single change from one version of a service to another

fields.description: Records the timestamp of when the actual change occurred (vs. when we created the changed record)
fields.name: changed_at

fields.description: Records who made the actual change
fields.name: changed_by

change_version.description: Represents a simpler model of a version specifically for the use case of displaying changes

cleartext_token.description: Separate resource used only for the few actions that require the full token.

fields.description: The actual token. Guaranteed to be globally unique.
fields.name: token

fields.description: The actual source code.
fields.name: source

fields.description: A collection of source files
fields.name: files

diff_breaking.description: Represents a single breaking diff of an application version. A breaking diff indicates that it is possible for an existing client to now experience an error or invalid data due to the diff.

diff_non_breaking.description: Represents a single NON breaking diff of an application version.

fields.example: name diffed from foo to bar
fields.name: description

domain.description: Represents a single domain name (e.g. www.apibuilder.io). When a new user registers and confirms their email, we automatically associate that user with a member of the organization associated with their domain. For example, if you confirm your account with an email address of example@somedomain.com, we will automatically create a membership request on your behalf to join the organization with domain somedomain.com.

fields.description: The domain name
fields.name: name

email_verification_confirmation_form.description: Data used to confirm an email address. The token is an internal unique identifier used to lookup the specific email address and user account for which we sent an email verification email.

fields.description: Machine readable code for this specific error message
fields.name: code

fields.description: Description of the error
fields.name: message

generator_service.description: Defines a service that provides one or more code generators

generator_with_service.description: Wraps a service and a generator providing easier access for applications.

item.description: When searching for content, the results of the search will be a list of items. Each item will have enough information to render for the user, including a type and item_guid to enable creating the appropriate link.

fields.description: Unique identifier for this item. By using a UUID, you can combine with the type to figure out the URI for the resource
fields.name: guid

membership.description: A membership represents a user in a specific role to an organization. Memberships cannot be created directly. Instead you first create a membership request, then that request is either accepted or declined.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The role this user plays for this organization. Typically member or admin.
fields.name: role

membership_request.description: A membership request represents a user requesting to join an organization with a specific role (e.g. as a member or an admin). Membership requests can be reviewed by any current admin of the organization who can either accept or decline the request.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this membership request.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The requested role for membership to this organization. Typically member or admin.
fields.name: role

fields.description: The key of the organization to which we are moving this item
fields.name: org_key

organization.description: An organization is used to group a set of applications together.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this organization.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: Used as a unique key in the URL path. Key is automatically derived from the organization name.
fields.name: key

fields.description: The name of this organization.
fields.name: name

fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.
fields.name: namespace

fields.description: Defaults to a url friendly version of the name
fields.name: key

fields.description: Global namespace for this organization.
fields.name: namespace

fields.description: Public organizations will be listed in apibuilder directory. Organizations with visibility organization will only be visible to members of that org.
fields.name: visibility

original.description: Represents the original input used to create an application version

fields.description: If not specified, we set the type by inspecting the data
fields.name: type

password_reset.description: Allows a user to change their password with authentication from a token.

fields.description: Unique one time use token to change a password
fields.name: token

password_reset_request.description: Create a password reset request - e.g. an email containing a one time URL to change a password

fields.description: The email address for which we generate the password reset.
fields.name: email

session.description: Represents a user sessions (e.g. user logged into site)

fields.description: Cryptographically secure session id
fields.name: id

subscription.description: Represents a user that is currently subscribed to a publication

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this subscription record
fields.name: guid

token.description: A token gives a user access to the API.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this token.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The user to which this token belongs.
fields.name: user

fields.description: The masked from of the token.
fields.name: masked_token

fields.description: optional description to help the user manage the token.
fields.name: description

fields.description: The user for which we are creating the token.
fields.name: user_guid

user.description: A user is a top level person interacting with the api doc server.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: Public unique identifier for this user.
fields.name: nickname

fields.description: Defaults to a unique identifier based on email address
fields.name: nickname

user_summary.description: Summary of a user sufficient for display

validation.description: Used only to validate json files - used as a resource where http status code defines success

fields.description: If true, the json schema is valid. If false, there is at least one validation error.
fields.name: valid

fields.description: Contains any validation errors that result from parsing the json document. If empty, the document is valid.
fields.name: errors

version.description: Represents a unique version of the application.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this version.
fields.name: guid

fields.description: The tag for this version. Can be anything, but if semver style version number is used, we automatically correctly sort by version number to find latest. Otherwise latest version is considered to be the most recently created.
fields.name: version

fields.description: The original uploaded file describing this version, if available
fields.name: original

fields.description: spec/spec.json description of this API
fields.name: service

fields.description: If provided, updates the visibility for all versions of this application
fields.name: visibility

watch.description: Users can watch individual applications which enables features like receiving an email notification when there is a new version of an application.

fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this watch
fields.name: guid

name: apibuilder api

operations.description: Returns the versions associated with the specified application. The latest version is the first result returned.

parameters.description: The number of records to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.
parameters.name: offset

operations.description: Returns the latest version number as a string
Search all applications. Results are always paginated.

parameters.description: The organization key for which to search applications
parameters.name: orgKey

parameters.description: The name of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: The guid of an application. Exact match
parameters.name: guid

parameters.description: The key of an application. Case in-sensitive. Exact match
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: If true, we return applications that have at least one version. If false, we return applications that have no versions in the system
parameters.name: has_version

parameters.description: The number of records to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.
parameters.name: offset

Updates an application.
Deletes a specific application and its associated versions.
Moves application to a new organization.

parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.
parameters.name: offset

Create or update a new attribute value.

Change the password for this token. If the token is invalid, has been used, or otherwise no longer can be applied, errors will be returned as 409s. A 204 represents that the user has successfully changed their password.
Create a new password reset. This will send the user an email with a link to reset their password.

operations.description: Used to fetch the clear text token.
Create a new API token for this user
Search for a specific user. You must specify at least 1 parameter - either a guid, email or token - and will receive back either 0 or 1 users.

parameters.description: Find user with this guid. Exact match
parameters.name: guid

parameters.description: Find user with this email address. Case in-sensitive. Exact match
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Find user with the specified nickname. For users that register via GitHub, this will be their GitHub username. Case in-sensitive. Exact match
parameters.name: nickname

parameters.description: Find the user with this API token. Exact match
parameters.name: token

operations.description: Returns information about the user with this guid.

Used to authenticate a user with an email address and password. Successful authentication returns an instance of the user model. Failed authorizations of any kind are returned as a generic error with code user_authorization_failed.
Used to authenticate a user using a github access token. This is equivalent to running the following command to get the user info: curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer code' https://api.github.com/user

parameters.description: The GitHub assigned oauth token
parameters.name: token

operations.description: Create a new user.
Updates information about the user with the specified guid.

parameters.name: sub_type_name

parameters.name: optional_fields
